title: What can I do when the 1st and 2nd or 3rd form of a verb is the same? - Quora

response.answer_text: What else can you do? Use it. Diamond cuts diamonds Yesterday, the power supply was cut. He has cut the cloth neatly. (You can't put putted instead of putting putten — just kidding:)

Hi Karan! Thanks for the request! At such times you should be happy that you don’t have to worry about the variations of the past and the participle form! CUT-CUT-CUT Job is simple in such cases. However there is a case I would like to share with you- Some verbs have only the ‘-ed’ form, but some verbs change in the ‘i-a-u’ pattern. (Ring-Rang-Rung) The movie “Honey, I shrunk the kids” was released (1989), and I wondered shouldn’t it be - “Honey, I shrank the kids”? In your case when the all the three are the same - Life is good! Hope this helped! Cheers!
